adminId: put any user IDs that need to control the bot here

api.tenor: You can get your API key for this and more info at https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/tenor.googleapis.com
api.snipcart: we don't have a way to test the API right now

db.note: (Don't change this value, it's a note.) Connection string format: (mongodb(+srv?) or localhost:27017)://<username>:<password>@<connection>

webhooks.mcTesting: Webhook url for testing interactions with Minecraft chat

missionMail.note: you may be able to just use your password if you don't have 2 factor enabled, but I know if you have 2 factor enabled you can search 'app password' in security settings and generate an app password to put here - works as of 4-15-2025

old.note: you must: 1) create a web app oAuth 2.0 client id and download the json. 1a) add the email to the testers for your oauth app 2) copy the values into their place below. 3) go to 'https://developers.google.com/oauthplayground/' 3a) select use your own OAuth credentials, and copy in from below. 3b) select mail.google.com in the left menu and hit 'authorize apis' 3c) follow through with the gmail account you wish to link to the bot, 3d) exchange the auth code for tokens 4) copy in the refresh token into 'gAccountRefreshToken' below, and make sure to fill in the email. 5) enable it above

google.api: You can get your API key for this and more info at https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/sheets.googleapis.com

creds.type: Create a project, give it access to google sheets, and create a service account credential. Download the JSON and that should fit in this object
